text: The Lieutenant Governor of Jersey (, Jèrriais: Gouvèrneux d'Jèrri) is the representative of the British monarch in the Bailiwick of Jersey, a Crown dependency of the British Crown. ==List of lieutenant governors of Jersey== Lieutenant Governors of Jersey have been: Title Appointed Name 1634 Sir Philippe de Carteret (Royalist) 26 August 1643 Major Lydcott (Parliament) 24 November 1643 Sir George Carteret (Royalist) at least by 1689 Edward Harris 3 March 1695 Col.
